item.description:
Hi Everyone,

The Wildlife Refuge is a beautiful scenic area, some sections recovered and rehabilitated by RI DEM from 1995 and continuing to present. 
http://www.fws.gov/refuges/profiles/index.cfm?id=53543 . 

This winter a snowy owl has taken up residence at the refuge.  Hopefully we get an opportunity to see this large white owl at Sachuest Point during the 1.5 hour walk around.  Deer are, also, very common to see on the trail.  Bring binoculars, camera, warm jacket, gloves and decent winter shoes.   

After the walk we are invited to a local residence for "order in" lunch, pizza and soft drinks.  You can bring some beer and wine. We will compare notes on our bird watch experience  and relax.  For those who would like to continue the social time we can island hop for entertainment to the Narragansett Cafe (no cover) in Jamestown 4-7 for an excellent blues band Ryan and the Blue Hearts http://www.ryanhartt.com/Blue_Hearts/Home.html.

We have a new host for this event, David B.  He will be taking us on the tour, and leading us to the Narragansett Cafe afterwards.  It sounds like a fun time for both nature lovers and casual hang-outs.

Hope you can come to David's first event!

Tonia
item.name: Wildlife Refuge @ Sachuest Point & Narragansett Cafe in Jamestown
